bibl.title: Letter from J.W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, January 26, 1915

div1.p: Kerr questions the need for multiple investigators examining one subject.

div1.head: Letter from J.W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, January 26, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 26, 1915. CD
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Dr. von Ezdorf's letter requesting authority to study
the Muscle Shoals impounding reservoir brings up the ques-
tion whether or not for the present the studies of impound-
ing reservoirs should not be made by Le Prince and yourself.
While I would not wish to do anything to deprive von Ezdorf
of an opportunity to become familiar with this subject, it
would seem that the studies of several reservoirs should be
made by the same investigators in order that comparisons
might be made. Perhaps, on the other hand, it might be a
good plan for von Ezdorf also to study this subject, and
the Service concentrate, as it were, in making intensive
studies of impounding waters.
